conclusion: Determine the power of lamp L2 using the formula P = V^2/R.
Power formula involves voltage V and resistance R.
Voltage across lamp L1 is equal to the battery voltage, V_L1 = 3V.
Voltage across lamp L2 is equal to the battery voltage, V_L2 = 6V.
Calculate power of lamp L2 using P = V^2/R with V_L2 = 6V and R = 1 Ohm, resulting in P_L2 = 36W.
Actual power P2 of lamp L2 is determined to be 36W.
